review_title: Great company to work for ethical, green, social business
pros: Staff are well supported with good professional development opportunities available.  It is a social business and the work is very rewarding. Strategically this is a forward thinking organisation who always tries to stay ahead of the game and be an influencer.
cons: You can't always have the answers and it's often difficult to say no to customers.  That's about all really.
Management want the best for them not for the tenants

job_title: HR-Manager und HR Business Partner in Peterborough, England
pros: Non existent pros other than you get paid
cons: No career development offered unless your face fits

pros: great people, really work hard for the community
cons: Th eleadership team are in a very neat clique. Perhaps out of touch with their staff
Awful management, very fearful of employees being better than them. No Promotion Possibilities

pros: Great peers and coworkers, wanting to work together and make a difference.
cons: Some of the managers and directors are psycho. You have no idea how you’re doing sometimes... and setting boundaries with them isn’t possible. They expect you to constantly do more for the company without extra compensation when you already go above and beyond in your job. They often create division among the other employees.

pros: The people that are all running scared if they’ll come in tomorrow and not have a job anymore
cons: Free, smelly gym. Not much else.

pros: Good community ethos,  strategically sound with determined focus to develop and build communitis not just homes.
cons: Company politics can cause those with altruistic tendencies to feel like giving up. Very often expected to spin many plates with little appreciation for details.

review_title: Does not deliver what it says on the tin
pros: Many of the employees are passionate about what they do, helpful, supportive and want to do a good job for their customers.
cons: Awful working culture, dictatorial, lack of trust and empowerment. The type of business & the way it is led are contradictory & often in conflict. Wasting money, poor direction, lack of empathy (unless you are in favour at the time - which can change like the wind and without justification other than personal opinion) and treating employees unfairly & unprofessionally. A local community based employer trying to operate like a large impersonal corporate business

pros: A place were colleagues support each other towards a social aim.
cons: I can't think of any cons.
